comment: The class itself is quite boring, but for a senior level class, everything was very straightforward and streamlined. The rubric and instructions make him seem much scarier than he actually is (he's quite kind and caring when you talk to him!).Receiving no feedback means you're doing well. Cite the book and follow the prompts-- you'll do just fine.

I took Corrections online. All of the grading criteria was clear and grades came back in a timely manner. My only complaint was that there were no lectures or recordings of any kind, so you have to read the textbook chapter for every single module from start to finish if you want to do well. Discussion posts take a long time to complete, too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: For an online prof, super engaged. Emails were funny. Clear grading expectations and no weird questions in the quiz. Research paper was straightforward and I actually liked topics (corrections). Prof. cares about general ideas rather than weird specific facts. Would take again, Fenton is a great guy!

This was an easy senior seminar class. The papers were not bad at all.The reaction paper was less than 2 pages and you only have to use the textbook. The midterm and final are papers but you only have to use the textbook and they are not super time consuming. The research paper is open all semester to work on. I would take again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Online Savvy

comment: All i have to say is.. 4 PAPERS. Its outrageous and unheard of. I dont know how anyone can rate him "easy" A reaction paper due a month into the semester, the midterm is a paper. You must answer 3 questions AT LEAST 2 pages long. Then a research paper.. AND THE FINAL IS A PAPER TOO. Answer 3 questions, AT LEAST 2 pages long.. I would not recommend.
Great class for an online senior seminar course. Discussion and quiz every week, midterm and final which are papers, and a research paper. Straight forward class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I have senior seminar online with Professor Fenton. As long as you do the discussion posts, this class is easy. Quizzes and tests aren't lockdown, and the information is straightforward. Easy work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Fenton is great. This is my second time taking him online. Everything is straightforward, weekly modules & discussions, 2 papers, a midterm and a final. His work isn't difficult at all and if you email him he's great at responding in a timely manner. Highly recommend taking him.
Taking him now, great professor!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He does is discussion posts that are barely relevant to your module but the tests are EXTREMELY HARD. He does not prepare you for the tests. There are 2 papers and the instructions are super vague. I spent all day on the paper and he gave me a 0 because i did not use in text citation and when i emailed him he was rude.
Loved this professor, he made it organized crime so interesting! Im so sad he is retiring, I wish I could take him more!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Respected

comment: Has great stories from years of experience in the CJ field, so his lectures are interesting. Exams are tough if you just assume you know what he will choose from a chapter to test on, read the entire thing. Don't miss class. Only reason I didn't make an A was because I didn't deserve one.  Quality professor. Most importantly, he is a fair grader.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Good professor. His lectures are pretty interesting and he seems to have a lot of experience. No cell phones/ laptops in class though so it's impossible to tune him out. I honestly liked it that way, as I have learned a lot because I had no choice. There are 5  1-3 page papers and a final. Drops lowest paper grade. Would take again.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are interesting if you are into criminal justice. Very happy to talk about current events. But lets get to the meat of this. The first 3 tests I failed.  Study notes, study notes, study notes. Then look through the book.  Take notes of whatever he puts on the board. I did this last three tests and made 100's. I got a B out of the course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Peter Fenton was a very difficult professor. There were only test grades and his tests were VERY hard. Overall his class was unnecessarily hard for a survey course. He is not very specific with what he wants you to learn from the book. His final is cumulative, 50 questions and FILL IN THE BLANK. If you're up for the challenge go right ahead...

For ethics, there's 5 1-3 page papers and you can drop one of them. He's fun to listen to and he loves telling stories during class. He always finds a way to tie it back into the lecture. If you don't go to class, you can end up with a really bad grade. You're gonna need the book because of the papers and the way the final is.

You can tell he really enjoys Organized Crime. He loves answering questions and making sure students understand the content. It can get a little rocky in the end of the semester with some of the odd terms, but he teaches lecture style, and loves participation. If you're having a hard time, he'll make time to meet with you and do his best to help.

He teaches the lectures from the book, but when he's teaching, he's not so much reading out of the book as he is comparing it to real world or understandable circumstances. In Ethics, he gives papers, and can be a tough grader. He doesn't clearly tell you why you got the grade, but if you ask, he's more than happy to help you understand.

It's the internship. Everything must be done the way he wants, when he wants. If you do it, you'll get the A. Make sure to write and present to meet all the requirements and nail the rubric. It's a good idea to have handouts in the presentation - I lost a few points because I didn't. Relatively easy A.
Great professor. Knows what he is talking about. Grades papers very hard but if you pay attention in class it shouldn't be too hard to get at least a B.

He gives you four papers, where he gives you the chance to skip one or drop the lowest. The papers are fairly short, and easy to write about. His lectures are out of the book, with his own spin so he makes it more understandable, and enjoyed taking questions from people. I really enjoyed his class and personal stories.

Really nice guy. He definitely knows his stuff. Just a typical guy teacher. Non mandatory attendance. We get out early sometimes. 5 assignments (drop lowest grade) and a final. He really does just want people to succeed. Lectures aren't boring he's got lots of stories. Probably one of the coolest profs I've had at Kennesaw. Take him, trust me.

Dr. Fenton's real world experience spiced ethics up a little. 20% of the grade is his open note final exam. It was M/C and essay. Come to class every day for notes and you'll be fine. The other 80% is 5 ethical dilemmas you address in 2-3 page papers and then discuss in class (mandatory or it's a 0). 20% each; there are 5 and he drops the lowest.

Great teacher!! Loved his class!! Doesn't use book much but you still need it. He is very interesting and funny. Very laid back guy and has done every criminal justice job possible meaning he has a lot of experience. Wish I could take him for all my classes.
By far the BEST professor! He reached from experience and not notes or the book. He knows his stuff, tests are clear, and he is helpful. Wish he taught more classes. Take him!
Attendance not mandatory, 5 assignments (drop the lowest) and a final, equally weighted. Go to class because you will need the notes for the final

This class was exactly what I expected course wise. There are 3 tests and a project, equally weighted. Atttendance is not mandatory, but helpful because tests are open notes. Would have had an A, but bombed t he first test because I missed 2 days in a row. So go to class!!
Most interesting professor I have ever had...
Fenton is a great professor. He give open note tests and doesn't require attendance. You can tell he really knows what he's talking about.

I took this class as an upper level elective and loved it! His tests are open note but if you don't come to class, you won't have the notes. He doesn't take attendance but you'll want to be there. He enjoys what he does and it shows. The group project is time consuming and tough but if you put in the work you'll do fine. I ended up with an A. Take him if you can!!! He's awesome.

Fenton is awesome. Subject was boring but he did a good job of making class interesting. 5 papers, you will probably get an A on them as long as they're long enough and you address the topic(s). 1 test (final), was open note. Taking him again this semester, looking forward to it! Take him if you can!

I took him for Ethics in Criminal Justice. We had 5 papers the entire semester, which he drops the lowest one, then a final which weights equally with the papers. He was boring, but so is the subject. I didn't go to class for 5 weeks and made a high B without much effort. I'm sure anyone that puts in a little more work could make an A with ease.

Very good professor. Tests are straight from the notes, which you may use for the tests. If you aren't good at taking notes, this isn't your class. A lot of the material is not from the book. Could have done without book, but it did help some.
I took this calls over the summer. It's a very easy class. All test are open notes. I didn't need the book at all. Some of the lectures are boring, but overall it's a pretty good class.
Love this teacher! He is such a great professor who really holds your interest in class, even through lecturing. His class is so fun, challenging, yet not hard. Love the class and teacher overall!

Took him over the summer and I had a good time. We had group discussions every week which are much better than presentations in front of the class. He's informal and down to earth and won't try to talk above you. I really liked this about him. We had no tests, just a final. I'd take him again, if he taught like this in all his classes.

Very nice man and funny. Knows his stuff but every class is a lecture. It can be a little boring at times but if you pay attention you will learn a lot. Tests are all open note and lowest test grade is dropped and replaced with a court observation paper you have to write. Good professor but sometimes lectures are boring.

For the life of me...I can't figure out why students give this professor such a high rating. Most of the student fall asleep in the class. The Professor just talks...and talks. I didn't witness any student participation.
The grade is based on 3 test, one paper, group project. He does not drop a low grade, and there is no extra credit.

Not always an easy topic to teach, but Fenton makes it interesting and certainly makes you think. Tests are part multiple choice, part essay. Attending class is really essential to "get" some of the ideas presented. I would take him again in a minute!

Amazing teacher that brings real-life experience to the classroom! He doesn't belabor the stuff you don't need, just gives you what you do and is entertaining so it sticks. Tests are multiple choice, no papers, but a practical final. He's terrific and I highly recommend.
Great professor, makes material interesting and class enjoyable. Very helpful.

this class was super easy! open note tests, a total of 4 but drops the lowest, a paper and final all worth 20%. he is knowledgeable about criminal justice and make it interesting. i was taking this class as an elective and i love it!!!!

Ethics class makes you think.  He is very fair and is also very interesting.  Go to class and read your chapters!!!  Pop quizzes are hard (fill in blank) but tests are mult choice and essay.  Not an easy A but not impossible either.  He is a wonderful teacher and will help you in any way he can to pass his class.  No extra credit though.

Organized Crime class is very interesting especially with stories he has from working in that field.  Go to class and read the chapters!  He is a very challenging teacher.  His classes are fun and interesting, but he likes to test you on detail.  Project is fun!  Tests 70% mult ch and 30% essay. Not an easy A but not impossible either! Great Guy!
Prof Fenton is fantastic!  Hiss grading is a bit tough on the tests, but he is fair, knowledgeable and wonderful!  One of the very best professors at KSU.
This is the second time I've had Fenton and I like him even better after this class. There are 6 tests and they are short and very easy. Not necessary to go to class but it definitely helps.
He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is a very fair grader, and an easygoing guy. Attendance is not mandatory but I recommend going to class.

the class is not hard and attendance is not mandatory but like all his classes there are 4-5 test and they are 70%mc and 30% essay. essays are hard and he grades them hard. do not recommend. i got b but i had to work for it. he gives no extra credit work.

class was interesting and good discussions. if class does not participate class will be boring. test are 70% mc and 30% essay. he grades very hard on essay. class not easy due to essay portion of test. attendance not mandatory.
Attendance isn't mandatory but most tests are straight from brief notes. It's worth going. Class isn't too boring and doesn't make you write down anything pointless. A fair guy.
Fenton is one of the best professors I've ever had and Organized Crime was the most fun and interesting class I've ever taken. I suggest this class to anyone- you will have a blast!

Professor Fenton took over class halfway through the semester for Cikovic. I thought the transition was going to be hard, but he ended up being a great professor with stories to tell and told us exactly what we needed to know for exams. There is no BS about him and is willing to help if needed. Take him if you want an easy A and a great professor!
Best CJ teacher at KSU!  This class was not easy by any means, but I learned a lot and it was worth it.

Professor Fenton was one of the most dynamic teachers I ever had.  He made the class interesting and challenged you at the same time.  If I could take him for ever criminal justice class I would.  Definetly knew his material.  He is also a great person to have an aquaintence with.

The best teacher I've ever had. No other University has ever spark my interest in Criminal Justice the way Professor Fenton has. Very concerned and interested in his students learning. If you get anything below a B in his class you should reconsider being in college. Test are very easy. He explains everything and gives a review before the test.

Pete Fenton is hands down the best teacher I have EVER had. The class material is a little dry during the first part (theories) but he makes it as interesting as the subject could possibly be.  Class consisted of 4 tests (can drop the lowest), a paper, and an essay final. Pay attention and take notes and you will do fine!
He was a great teacher, easy to understand and easy to approach about questions.
Great techer very clear and knowledgeable about Criminal Justice and ethics.

Fenton is the best teacher ever and I wish he taught every class I have! He brings tons of facts/stories to class everyday which made me go every day (even though there was no attendence policy). Some studying is required but if you just listen to him he explains everything perfectly and makes it fun to learn. again he's the best teacher ever!
Excellent teacher. Always available for his students. Has to be one of the best. Take him for any and everything in Criminal Justice and if you need an elective. You won't regret it.

Excellent teacher. Never got tired of his stories and wonderful comments about life as a Lawyer and a police officer. Always finds time to work with his students and is very understanding. Has to be one of  the Best teachers at KSU

I took this class as a non-business elective. It was so easy and I barely came to class. Problem is that his tests are directly from the notes and some from the book. If you take the class make sure you show up and take notes. Easiest class ever and the professor was amazing. He made class so fun and interesting.
No Comments

This class is pretty easy, you do want to show up though (doesn't take attendance grade). he is a really cool teacher. very easy to get along with. you do want to study for the tests but they aren't too hard. very cool class
BEST TEACHER EVAR!!!!!!!!
awesome, very knowledgeable!

Very good teacher. Very willing to help and explains everything until you understand. Gives outlines for chapters that will be on test. Tests can be tough, would not recommend missing class but no attendence. Fun project if you take his Organized Crime class.
Took this over the summer. Great class, very interesting, pretty engaging, and he's funny.
tought a class at my police academy! Very Interesting / great teacher!

Excellent prof, 4 easy tests, 1 major paper to write. If you hate taking a lot of notes take him, very precise lectures. No reading required from the book. Just study his handouts and your short notes

outstanding professor.  He made the class very interesting.  If you come to class and pay attention, you will get A's on all of the exam.  There was a paper assignment but he did not grade very hard on it.  I wish that I could take him again.
